body:
@glitch I noticed that the getTables validation will fail on all of the accumulo table IDs.  The ALPHA_NUM_REGEX doesn't like "+" or the "!0" ID.  

I am not sure what the best way to fix this would be.  We could either add a more complicated regex that will allow the special IDs or change the REST interface to use table names instead of IDs.  Thoughts?
Created https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ACCUMULO-4756 for this issue
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
@ctubbsii I ran ShellServerIT in master and it is failing there as well.  I think this is failing due to a recent, different change.
I think the ShellServerIT test is unrelated. The pattern in the error message is clearly different than the one changed in this PR.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?

Am seeing the following on a few tests (HalfDeadTServerIT, BulkImportMonitoringIT) with the hadoop2 profile

```
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/sun/jersey/spi/container/servlet/ServletContainer
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.ServletContainer
```

I'm guessing our exclusions are too aggressive on hadoop-minicluster or something?

(This comment initially incorrectly posted to #290)

@billoley 

Okay, I'm merging this now. Since the implementation changed a bit in each commit, I'm going to squash it down and clean up the log message, so the commit logs aren't confusingly describing the implementations before the final one.

Thanks for the contribution! I hadn't realized this, but this looks like your first contribution to the Apache Accumulo project. If you'd like to be added to the contributors list at https://accumulo.apache.org/people , please file a pull request to update  https://github.com/apache/accumulo-website/blob/master/pages/people.md (or just let me know the details you'd want included here, and I can update the site for you).

I've added you as a contributor in JIRA already, so I can assign the https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ACCUMULO-4693 to you. Now, you'll be able to self-assign issues, if you find any in the future you want to work on.

I'm surprised about the errors with the hadoop2 profile. Shouldn't that profile reflect what we already have today? These may just be general errors in master that haven't yet been dealt with, unrelated to your changes.

It might be a good idea to try this changeset on the 1.8 branch instead of master, because that's likely much more stable.

> I'm surprised about the errors with the hadoop2 profile. Shouldn't that profile reflect what we already have today? These may just be general errors in master that haven't yet been dealt with, unrelated to your changes.

Yup. Will investigate them further this morning.

> It might be a good idea to try this changeset on the 1.8 branch instead of master, because that's likely much more stable.

Did we have consensus where we wanted this to land? (also @keith-turner) 1.7, 1.8, master? Just 1.8, master? I'd say all three, but don't care too much.

Running `-Phadoop3` went well last night. Some dependency-analysis issues to fix, some test timeoutss, and some tests which appears to be broken (ShellServerIT, SummaryIT, MonitorSslIT)
Will this PR have any impact on the tar.gz file?

> Did we have consensus where we wanted this to land? (also @keith-turner) 1.7, 1.8, master? Just 1.8, master? I'd say all three, but don't care too much.

I don't know. My suggestion to try against 1.8 was mostly just a practical one, just to see the test results without running into master instabilities.

IMO, I would say 1.8 (which should become 1.9) and later. I think the 1.7 branch should be closed out with a "soft" EOL like we usually do, after pushing out 1.7.4. I just don't think significant changes/fixes/etc. are worth it in 1.7 when 1.8 is the currently best supported version.

> Will this PR have any impact on the tar.gz file?

No, we don't bundle any hadoop JARs, actually.

> IMO, I would say 1.8 (which should become 1.9) and later

Will go for this then.

> >    Will this PR have any impact on the tar.gz file?
> No, we don't bundle any hadoop JARs, actually.

I guess we do have to figure out some recommendations for users, otherwise we'll have this same problem at runtime. We'd need to update what general.classpaths has for H3 installations.

> Am seeing the following on a few tests (HalfDeadTServerIT, BulkImportMonitoringIT) with the hadoop2 profile

Seems to be broken on Master prior. Let me just rebase this on 1.8...
Can one of the admins verify this patch?

I pushed a quick fix with an updated log message which mentions cleanup of flot minimized files and moving flot into the external resources section of the template. No code change from the initial PR. Just an updated log message.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
My approval was merely a thank you for the information so thanks!
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Closing PR, having some inconsistent behavior. Will resubmit.

@ctubbsii I sent you an update to this branch for the recently released 1.2 of the library-detetors plugin.  I added the exceptions to the pom that we were missing so it will successfully run against current 1.7 code.  Although now I am thinking we want to close this PR and just make these changes against master.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
ok to test
@milleruntime, this doesn't fix a bug so I am not too keen on putting it in 1.8 or 1.7

Thanks @ctubbsii . I shortened the commit header message and found the unused import. I'm not quite sure why my local build did not alert me to the unused import. I had run checkstyle locally but it passed for me.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Closing in favor of #340
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Sorry. Didn't get a chance to merge your change to my previous branch, and rebase on master. But, this PR works, too. :smile:
I ended up merging this onto a rebase'd #298
It might depend on how you run checkstyle. I use `mvn clean verify -DskipTests`.
Squashed and merged. I confirmed that jaxb-api is brought in from Hadoop's class path.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?

I think most comments have been addressed. Let me know if there are more or if I missed some. 

I do have a concern about one of the tests that I hope someone can assist me with. The 'testSetPropertiesAndGroups' test sets two generic properties and a locality group prior to creating the table. After creation I call conn.tableOperations().getProperties to retrieve the properties of the table. I check for the properties of the locality groups and I have tried checking for the generic properties as well. The locality group properties are retrieved without issue. But, the generic properties are not returned. I expected that I would see them as well. Am I missing some step in the setProperties process or misunderstanding the use of the NewTableConfiguration.setProperties method? I have followed through the code and  verified that when the CreateTable() constructor is eventually called the generic properties are still in the supplied options Map. Suggestions or clarification of my expectations would be appreciated.

@jmark99 is that test consistently failing for you?  I just merged your branch into master locally and was able to run your new IT 5 or 6 times without failure (I ran just that IT in Eclipse over and over).  So I am curious if it fails intermittently and I need to run it more or if it fails all the time for you.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?

@keith-turner thanks for pointing that out. I guess I wasn't aware of that requirement for the tables. I'll update and push out the changes. I can add a follow-on ticket to look more closely into how to handle the situation when non-table properties are set. Thanks again.
@joshelser Would you have a moment to review this?  Thank you!

@keith-turner when using the "prop1" alone, there was no indication of an error. The properties were simply not returned when calling getProperties. I didn't check zookeeper. I'll have to go back and take a look at that.

On [line 59 of PopulateZookeeper](https://github.com/apache/accumulo/blob/rel/1.8.1/server/master/src/main/java/org/apache/accumulo/master/tableOps/PopulateZookeeper.java#L59) the method [TablePropUtil.setTableProperty()](https://github.com/apache/accumulo/blob/rel/1.8.1/server/base/src/main/java/org/apache/accumulo/server/util/TablePropUtil.java#L31) is called.  This method returns a boolean which PopulateZookeeper ignores. 

For context, PopulateZookeeper is a step in the FATE operations that create a table.

On the server side, the props could be sanity checked before the fate operation is created. 

https://github.com/apache/accumulo/blob/rel/1.8.1/server/master/src/main/java/org/apache/accumulo/master/FateServiceHandler.java#L151
Thanks for the reviews.  I am going to make a few more similar changes that I missed and I will push an update soon.

Updated NewTableConfiguration.java to verify user-defined table properties are correctly named. Created additional test in NewConfigurationTestIT.java to verify the properties. Will create follow-on ticket to add checks to server user properties.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?

This looks good to merge. But first, I just want to double check that you intended the git author info in the commit to be: `someone <someone@someplace.net>`. Your previous commits have used the github noreply addresses, like `Nick Felts <31989480+PircDef@users.noreply.github.com>`. I'm not sure how GitHub's noreply addresses work, but either way, I think the someplace.net address should be avoided, since that's a real domain.
Glad you noticed, that was unintended.
Pretty sure I picked a suboptimal fix, but a new PR is up that should be fixed.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
Are you aware you can force push to the existing branch, and you don't need to create a new PR?

> Seems to be broken on Master prior. Let me just rebase this on 1.8...

Ok, finally got this done. @ctubbsii @phrocker  want to take another glance? sunny-day tests are passing for me.
This PR supersedes #343
I did not mean to push those most recent commits, still making some changes.
No worries @jkrdev its your branch, do as you please!

Whoops sorry clicked "close and Comment" instead of comment.

The only preference we have for working with pull requests is that you don't rebase during a review.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
I chose the wrong branch :(

>    Would an Accumulo instance built against one work with the other?

Unsure.

>    Do we need to have a different binary tarball assembly in a hadoop3 profile in the assemble module?

I'd guess for the same reason that our tests experience runtime errors, going against a real installation would similarly fail because of the beanutils dependency clashing.

I don't know if these shaded jars are included in the standard Hadoop installation path (my hunch is not). 

>    Does our default class path in our scripts/config templates need to be updated to include different jars from the Hadoop3 install dirs vs. the Hadoop2 install dirs?

FS layout hasn't changed AFAIK, but the above comment about beanutils would likely affect things.

> I don't know if these shaded jars are included in the standard Hadoop installation path (my hunch is not).

Oh, they are included:

```
hadoop-3.0.0/share/hadoop/client/
hadoop-3.0.0/share/hadoop/client/hadoop-client-runtime-3.0.0.jar
hadoop-3.0.0/share/hadoop/client/hadoop-client-minicluster-3.0.0.jar
hadoop-3.0.0/share/hadoop/client/hadoop-client-api-3.0.0.jar
```

I'll have to see if I can get this running today locally and test it out.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?

I haven't had time to do a full review of this yet, but wanted to remind that these new interfaces are necessarily in the public API, and we'll be stuck with the names of them for some time. So, if there's any better naming than the `-Step` pattern, we should discuss sooner rather than later.
@ctubbsii are you finished looking at this?
@keith-turner Yes. I'm finished now. I made one last comment up for discussion about the thrown exceptions, but the rest of the API looks fine to me.

I modified the exception from AccumuloException to IllegalArgumentException in the attachIterator method. Note that I catch the AccumuloException thrown by checkIteratorConflicts and then rethrow as an IllegalArgumentException.

So I will go through again and check them but most of the time when I use a `scanner = null;` outside of a try block followed by a `finally `block it is because the scanner gets re-assigned later on. When in a try-with-resources block the scanner becomes final therefore it can't be re-assigned later on.

I have noticed that throughout many of the ITs there is outdated code and in some instances whole folders (proxy) of ITs that have code that is deprecated. I don't know how I got about making a ticket but I think one should be opened about it. Theres code that can be replaced and some ITs that need to be fully refactored. I don't know if there is already a ticket about this but would be a nice fix.

@jkrdev In the case of the variable being reassigned, I think it makes sense to use a new variable (can keep the same name, but redeclared in each block). It results in cleaner code, and it's not like variable names are a limited commodity.

For the stale ITs you mention... if you see anything significant, you can just create a new issue in JIRA at: https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa for the "ACCUMULO" project (or just click on the "Create" button to create a new issue after logging in to that JIRA). If you have questions about whether you made the issue correctly, you can always ask on the dev@ mailing list, but chances are, somebody will triage the new issue whether you ask or not.
Can one of the admins verify this patch?
I merged into 1.7, and then 1.8 and master branches, then converted the new ThreadFactory to a lambda (less code) for the master branch.
@ctubbsii thanks for merging and I like the lambda

I believe I have added try-with-resources at every point through the ITs other than the proxy folder which is full of errors (I will make a ticket for that) and ReplicationIT.java in the replication folder. ReplicationIT.java has nested scanners I will try refactoring them. I will also go through all the files again to quadruple check.
Closing this PR since the work is complete.

I see that the conflicting file no longer exist in the master branch, I am not sure what I did to cause this conflict but if it is messing up the ability for the jenkins and travis to run then how do I fix the conflict? (I can delete the file but I feel as though that is not the proper way).

@joshelser Added a comment and changed to `long`. Ran the integration tests; a couple time outs, one of which was the `CyclicReplicationIT.dataIsNotOverReplicated` test.  May be the hardware I am running on isn't fast enough.

> Ran the integration tests; a couple time outs, one of which was the CyclicReplicationIT.dataIsNotOverReplicated test. May be the hardware I am running on isn't fast enough.

Hurm. I think some of these ITs magically became broken on 1.8 at some point and no one has made time to investigate them. I'd not expect your changes to be the cause of them not passing.
Yep. I built 1.8 and then loaded the updated user manual into my local browser and things looked as expected.
Oh ha okay I saw that Property.createInstanceFromPropertyName was only in 3 places so I just assumed. I will go through and review those.
If no one objects, I will close this PR due to conflicts/inactivity.
I believe I have replaced all the code in the appropriate places as well as removed AccumuloConfiguration.instantiateClassProperty method from the class.

I was looking at this briefly with @mikewalch and we were discussing ways that we could simplify the code for the overview page.  I think your fix is good but perhaps we could do this better with the ftl template.

@milleruntime I'll merge for now. It might make sense to turn this into a DataTables table, or do some other simplification in the template. I'll leave that to future work. For now, this will wrap up this bug.
Agreed. Sounds good
What do you guys think of 5373bb25fb49a83fd8fa1f565b683fe62738110f ?  It is a wrapper for DataTables so any JSON object we want to render we could just wrap with the class.

The more I think about wrapping the current REST endpoints, the more I realize that just complicates the backend. I am thinking the Monitor should be as simple as possible with everything useful that was in the old one.
I am going to close this PR so I can rebase, dropping the unnecessary commits.

@ivakegg Assuming you closed this in order to open against 1.8 (#356) Is that correct?

In future, if you click "Edit" next to the title, you can change the branch that this PR is pulled against, and do a force push to update your branch with the appropriate changeset... in case you didn't want to close and open a new issue in future. This is fine, too, though... it doesn't matter much. :smile_cat:
Also broken in 1.6.4 I believe
Correct
Good to know, but I think it's unlikely we'll reopen development on 1.6 to release a fix on that.
My mistake. Initially I did the PR against master instead of 1.8 and now Jenkins is reporting an error. I fixed it. It builds find against 1.8. Not sure how to force Jenkins to rerun, though.

@asfbot doesn't seem to be linking to this PR on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ACCUMULO-4611
I'll add one manually.
Awesome! Thanks for merging! And ha just let me know and I will try to get it done.

> Probably b/c you haven't sync'd with GitBox to be added to the repo? 

Thanks for the ping. I have no clue what that even means :)
Well, I did a thing on gitbox.a.o. Maybe that will do it?

> Well, I did a thing on gitbox.a.o. Maybe that will do it?

I think so. It seems to have added you to the list. It should also give you more control over the repos on GitHub, and related things, too (like being able to close issues or merge PRs from the UI, and add/remove labels, update milestones, and trigger rebuilds and clear caches on Travis CI).

In any case, I would appreciate a review of this if/when you get a chance. I understand how important it was to fix the commons-config in our API for Hadoop 3, and I want to make sure this change is in the direction we can all agree on.

The latest updates leave a few methods from the superclass not deprecated, because we're using them in our own code. If there are any more we need to keep around (such as some variant of getLong, etc.), let me know and I'll leave them in, too.
